page.title: 11 LOCAL HISTORY PART 6
page.content: ...deterioration but that it should also "truly replace the original in appearance and atmosphere." One explaination for the unusual shape of the well is that a horse drawing a trap shied and tossed the driver head first into the well. The roundhouse was built to stop anything like that happening again. Another story is that the building was done after the well water had been contaminated and caused an epidemic in the area. The final cost of the well's reconstruction was over one thousand eight hundred pounds, but estimates ranged from eight hundred and seventy five pounds to over two thousand pounds."
